question.text: Which of the following statement is not incorrect?

options.text: In the 1990s, Delhi ranked fourth among the 40 most polluted cities of the world.
All the buses of Delhi were converted to run on CNG by the end of 2000.
Euro III norms, for example, stipulate that sulphur be controlled at 350 parts-per-million (ppm) in diesel and 150 ppm in petrol.
Mass Emission Standards (Bharat Stage II which is equivalent to Euro-II norms) are applicable in all the cities of India.

solution.text:
Euro III norms, for example, stipulate that sulphur be controlled at 350 parts-per-million (ppm) in diesel and 150 ppm in petrol. Aromatic hydrocarbons are to be contained at 42 percent of the concerned fuel. The goal, according to the roadmap, is to reduce sulphur to 50 ppm in petrol and diesel and bring down the level to 35 percent. 

Mass Emission Standards (Bharat Stage II which is equivalent to Euro-II norms) are no more applicable in any of the cities of India.

In the 1990s, Delhi ranked fourth among the 41 most polluted cities of the world. All the buses of Delhi were converted to run on CNG by the end of 2002.
